sen.j: 善峯寺（よしみねでら）は、京都府京都市西京区にある寺院。
sen.e: Yoshimine-dera Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Yoshimine-dera Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Nishikyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Yoshimine-dera Temple is a Buddhist temple located in Nishikyo-ku Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 山号は西山。
sen.e: Its honorific mountain prefix is Nishiyama.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Nishiyama.
Its honorific mountain prefix is Nishiyama.

sen.j: 西国三十三箇所第20番札所。
sen.e: It is the 20th temple of the 33 Temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
It is the 20th temple of the 33 Temple Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
It is the 20th of the 33 temples that are visited during the Kansai Kannon Pilgrimage.
sen.cmt: 「西国三十三箇所」の訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 善峰観音宗（天台宗系単立）。
sen.e: Yoshimine Kannon school (independent Tendai Sect temple).
Yoshimine Kannon school (independent Tendai Sect temple).
Yoshimine Kannon school (independent temple of Tendai Sect).
sen.cmt: 「天台宗系単立」訳を修正しました。

sen.j: サクラや紅葉の名所になっているとともに境内各所から京都市街、比叡山を一望できる。
sen.e: In addition to being famous for its cherry blossoms an autumn leaves, a panoramic view of the city of Kyoto and Mt. Hiei can be seen from anywhere within the temple precinct.
In addition to being famous for its cherry blossoms and autumn leaves, a panoramic view of the city of Kyoto and Mt. Hiei can be seen from anywhere within the temple precinct.
In addition to being famous for its cherry blossoms and autumn leaves, a panoramic view of the city of Kyoto and Mt. Hiei can be seen from various places in the temple precinct.
sen.cmt: 「境内各所」の訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 起源と歴史
sen.e: Origin and History
Origin and History
Origin and History

sen.j: 長元2年（1029年）、源算が創建した。
sen.e: Founded in 1029 by Genzan.
Founded in 1029 by Genzan.
Yoshimine-dera Temple was founded in 1029 by Genzan.
sen.cmt: 他のトピックと表現をあわせました。

sen.j: その後、長元7年（1034年）には後一条天皇から「良峯寺」の寺号を賜った。
sen.e: It was later granted the name 'Yoshimine-dera' by Emperor Go-Ichijo in 1034.
It was later granted the name 'Yoshimine-dera' by Emperor Go-Ichijo in 1034.
It was later granted the name 'Yoshimine-dera' (良峯寺) by Emperor Goichijo in 1034.
sen.cmt: 「Go-Ichijo」→「Goichijo」とし、「良峯寺」を併記しました（表記の話題なので）。

sen.j: 鎌倉時代初期には慈円が住したことがあり、このころ後鳥羽天皇直筆の寺額を賜ったことによって寺号が善峯寺と改められた。
sen.e: Jien resided in the temple in the early Kamakura period and it was during this time that the kanji used to write the word 'yoshi' of the temple's name was changed after receiving a temple name tablet written by Emperor Go-Toba himself.

Jien resided in the temple in the early Kamakura period and it was during this time that the kanji used to write the word 'yoshi' of the temple's name was changed after receiving a temple name tablet written by Emperor Go-Toba himself.

Jien resided in the temple in the early Kamakura period and at this time, the temple name was changed its first chinese character from 良 to 善 after receiving a temple name tablet written by Emperor Go-Toba himself.
sen.cmt: 表記の話題のため、漢字を加え、表現を変えました。

sen.j: 青蓮院から多くの門跡が入山したため「西山門跡」と呼ばれた。
sen.e: It came to be known as 'Nishiyama Monzeki' as many Monzeki (Imperial Princes in holy orders) entered the Yoshimine-dera Temple from Shoren-in Temple.
It came to be known as 'Nishiyama Monzeki' as many Monzeki (Imperial Princes in holy orders) entered the Yoshimine-dera Temple from Shoren-in Temple.
It came to be known as 'Nishiyama Monzeki' as many Monzeki (Imperial Princes in holy orders) entered the Yoshimine-dera Temple from Shorenin Temple.

sen.j: 応仁の乱に巻き込まれて伽藍が消失したのち、江戸時代になってから桂昌院の寄進によって再興された。
sen.e: The buildings of the temple complex were lost after becoming embroiled in the Onin War but they were later rebuilt during the Edo period using funds donated by Keishoin.
The buildings of the temple complex were lost after becoming embroiled in the Onin War but they were later rebuilt during the Edo period using funds donated by Keishoin.
The buildings of the temple complex were lost after becoming embroiled in the Onin War but they were later rebuilt during the Edo period using funds donated by Keishoin.

sen.j: 元和 (日本)7年（1621年）に賢弘により再建されたもの。
sen.e: Constructed in 1621 by Kenko.
Constructed in 1621 by Kenko.
It was constructed in 1621 by Kenko.

sen.j: 絹本著色大元帥明王像
sen.e: Color on silk portrait of Atavaka
Color on silk portrait of Atavaka
Portrait of Atavaka, Color painting on silk

sen.j: 遊龍の松
sen.e: Yuryu-no-matsu (lit. playing dragon pine-tree)
Yuryu-no-matsu (lit. playing dragon pine-tree)
Yuryu-no-matsu (lit. playing dragon pine-tree)

sen.j: 樹齢約600年の五葉松で幹が横に這うように伸びていることからこの名が付けられた。
sen.e: This Japanese white pine is approximately 600 years old and was given its name due to its trunk that grows as if it is crawling horizontally.
This Japanese white pine is approximately 600 years old and was given its name due to its trunk that grows as if it is crawling horizontally.
This Japanese white pine is approximately 600 years old and was given its name due to its trunk that grows as if it is crawling horizontally.

sen.j: 全長54mあったが、松食い虫の被害により平成6年（1994年）15mあまり切断された。
sen.e: It once measured 54 meters in length but a15 meter section was removed in 1994 due to damage by pine weevils.
It once measured 54 meters in length but a 15 meter section was removed in 1994 due to damage by pine weevils.
It once measured 54 meters in length but a 15 meter section was removed in 1994 due to damage by pine weevils.

sen.j: 20 善峯寺 -- 21 穴太寺 -- 22 總持寺 (茨木市)
sen.e: 20. Yoshimine-dera Temple; 21. Anao-ji Temple; 22. Soji-ji Temple (Ibaraki City)
